conclusion: Determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles from points A, B, and C.
Point A is located near the top left.
Point B is located near the top center.
Point C is located near the top right.
Liquid starts at point A and flows downward.
Liquid encounters a black baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid continues flowing downward and to the right after the baffle.
Liquid encounters another baffle that further directs it to the right.
Liquid from point A flows into container D.
Liquid starts at point B and flows downward.
Liquid encounters a yellow baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid continues flowing downward and to the right after the baffle.
Liquid encounters another baffle that further directs it to the right.
Liquid from point B flows into container D.
Liquid starts at point C and flows downward.
Liquid encounters a pink baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid continues flowing downward and to the left after the baffle.
Liquid encounters another baffle that further directs it to the left.
Liquid from point C flows into container E.
Liquid from points A and B will flow into container D.
Liquid from point C will flow into container E.
